ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: The material covered in lectures is not nearly complex and deep enough to support what we had to do for the final project. Both lectures and homework assignments should be more difficult.
Very well taught in spite of technical difficulties with SimaPro.

Expanding in #2. This was a capstone class and the project/consulting engagement is a substantial part of the learning. Unfortunately some clients were very unresponsive, which prevents us from developing the relevant expertise outside of the academic setting.
The tool is powerful but it is not as powerful as GIS, and it seems like LCA can be combined with other consulting training to design a more well-rounded course.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Learning SimaPro was most challenging and the most valuable. I particularly enjoyed the clarity with which the concepts of life cycle assessment were taught. More case studies would have further contextualized these techniques.
Problem sets, working on SimaPro problems during class
The group project was by far the best aspect of the class and where I learned the most.
The group project was obviously the most valuable experience in the course, although the homework was also very helpful for illustrating key concepts.
Group work. The ability to problem-solve and test solutions.
client-facing work
Learning how to use SimaPro software.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: Both lectures and homework assignments should be more difficult.
Software instruction.
The lectures were sometimes dry and redundant. I think a better way to learn would be working through more simapro problems/cases in class.

It'd be helpful to add an early homework assignment that has students actively ask for data from their clients. Even though we knew it would take a long time to get client-specific data, no one really had any idea how long that process would actually take. I learned so much about their processes during those conversations, but it took over a month just to get them started. Another project-specific homework (perhaps in the first or second week) would be extremely helpful.

Ability to create and implement alternative approaches to learning the material and tools in case clients are unresponsive. There should be procedures in place to deal with situations like that. Also, reviewing homework assignments as a group once they have been returned.

Lectures should require computers off and attention at the front of the room. Then, when students are working on computers, they can go back to their seats, turn on computers, and begin work. Computers in front of our faces prevent us from focusing fully on the lecture.
Vetting clients for the final project to ensure that they are engaged and bought into the process.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: Very good.
It was effective. Homework reviews after they have been returned could help students apply lessons more efficiently.
n/a

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: Foundational to understanding business & environment techniques.
I am interested in public-private partnerships and this tool gives me an additional framework and tool to evaluate them.
I thought I might like to do LCA work as a part of my internship, but it's not something I care to do anymore. So, this class helped me determine that.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: LCA is an important concept and tool for environmental professionals.
To learn SimaPro.
I was eager to learn LCA. Seems to be a useful tool in business/industry and real sustainability planning.
To learn about the LCA framework and tool and be able to build a communication strategy for private sector sustainability much more effectively.
To learn SimaPro and to work with a client.
To understand how to model systems and learning about life cycle analysis as an environmental impact tool.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: yes
Yes

Yes, mostly. However, trying to work on the project in SimaPro as a team was pretty unwieldy. I wish I had a stronger command of SimaPro after taking this course, but I feel prepared to strengthen my expertise in the future as a result of taking this course.
Unfortunately the practical aspects that can only be learned by dealing with a client one on one was lacking.
Yes, I learned SimaPro. However, I would have also liked to refine our client protocols with guidance from Tom and Phil.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Advantage: It's nice to work with a real world client and work on practical projects. Disadvantage: My teammate does not do ANY work! He is very good at talking, but he doesn't do ANY work!

I did not enjoy group work as part of this class. I think some projects and the modeling work that goes with it just does not fit group settings well, especially when no one has the same schedule, or the same way of working. Lots of time is wasted just talking about what so and so did or did not do and what we should do or not do in the future, with endless discussions about the structure of the model. In addition, putting a lot of work in a project while others don't necessarily, and ending up with a mediocre result is frustrating and counterproductive. I don't know whether it is possible, but maybe having people try a group out with shorter assignments before delving into a semester long project would help? Or maybe letting people work on solo projects?

Advantages: working with a client and developing a working relationship with my class team. Disadvantages: didn't need to participate in all parts of the project i.e. do all the SimaPro modelling. Just be familiar with the process or do some of it. Sharing SimaPro files was very difficult and time consuming! The educational license is not sufficient to do this, or better explanation of sharing SimaPro database is needed.

It was great to learn from my peers, but it's tough to work on a project in which multiple people need access to one model. It might be better for projects to be smaller in scope in future semesters, with just 2 people per team.
See my response to Question 19.
pro: ability to draw from different expertise cons: lack of a process for team members to evaluate each other
Our group was productive and effective at times, but our dynamic could have been better during final deadline times.

Advantages - different perspectives and strengths contributed to a stronger project. Disadvantages - when building the SimaPro model and doing sensitivity analysis it was time consuming to keep each person in the group up to speed when model changes could not be done together.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Great explanation of concepts but be prepared to use software that is difficult to navigate.
Ensure commitment from your client to a work process early
Look to this experience as a great way to network with a client and work with a team. It is important to refine and craft the report and presentation of the material.
If they have Mac laptops, consider investing in getting a Windows license/bootcamp to avoid being limited to STAT lab for modeling.
